DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study assess efficacy calcifediol ( 25-hydroxyvitamin D ) calcitriol ( 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D ) prevent reduce severity acute kidney injury ( AKI ) critically ill patient .
DOC.brief_title: Activated Vitamin D Prevention Treatment Acute Kidney Injury
DOC.criteria: Age ≥ 18 Admitted ICU within 48h prior enrollment Likely remain ICU ( alive ) ≥72h Naso/orogastric tube ability swallow High risk severe AKI Serum total calcium > 9.0 mg/dl phosphate > 6.0 mg/dL within previous 48h Currently receive oral calcium supplementation Ingestion vitamin D3 > 1,000 IU/day 25hydroxyvitamin D 1,25dihydroxyvitamin D previous 7 day AKI stage 2 3 ( base KDIGO serum creatinine and/or urine output criterion ) History transplantation receive immunosuppressive medication ( include glucocorticoid steroid dose less equivalent prednisone 20 mg/day ) Neutropenia previous 48h Active primary parathyroid disease , active granulomatous disease , symptomatic nephrolithiasis previous 3 month Receiving cytochrome P450 inhibitor Chronic Kidney Disease stage V End Stage Renal Disease Hemoglobin < 7 g/dL GI malabsorption Prisoner Pregnancy breast feeding
